content.description: Start on low underclings in the hueco. Name says it all - big slaps up the huecos to the little ledge.
content.protection: Pads. Drop from the little ledge unless you want to do the highball slab
content.location: The left side finish of Police Brutality traverse (v5)

content.description: Stand start using obvious undercling and gaston. Easy move to a pinch undercling to the right (there is an awkward intermediate if you like), then big move to shelf. Enjoy the swing, move left on jugs, and top out.
content.protection: one pad for the crux, 2-3 if you aren't 100% on the topout.
content.location: In the corridor/cave left of triple slaps.

content.description: Start on the hole and brown edge in the face and follow the generous crack to the top.
content.protection: A few pads are nice. Stacking could also make the fall zone better
content.location: This route is located in the Police Brutality area, In the Corridor usually in the shade. This is just right of a tree and to the right of Guillotine.

content.description: Start on low on the right side of the wall on an edge and a slot.  Work left across the entire wall, and finish on Triple Slaps.  Drop off from the break or top out the dirty easy wall.
content.location: This problem is the long traverse behind the Asphalt boulder.  Standing in front of El Bano Direct, you can see this problem uphill and to the right.

content.description: A bit of an eliminate, but very good. Start below Mr Softy on the good holds, traverse right along the crimp rail and utilize some good but thin crimps to gain a flat horn feature out right. Topout straight up. The entirety of the rail for mr softy is off
content.location: To the right of Mr. Softy

content.description: Stand start on a rail and move up and right following the big rails. Once the rails stop top out.
content.protection: Pad, watch out to not fall onto the boulder behind this problem
content.location: Smaller boulder around 20 yards from the main Police Brutality area towards the valley

content.description: Start on sidepull and follow arete to mantle crux.
content.location: The left arete of The Guillotine near a wide corridor

content.description: Stand start in slots, make your way through tricky moves and precision into the "guillotine," a deep finger bucket. Pull jugs over the topout.
content.location: Right of the prominent arete on police brutality boulder

content.description:
A tall beautiful problem with a crux at 20 feet. Start on the obvious jug, and do the coolest moves ever to the crux, then go for it!  

  If there is one thing that Rocktown has, it is a great group of tall, gorgeous, scary v5s. I think this one is the best.
content.protection: If you fall in control, you really only need one pad from the crux, but you might not, and you might fall from the low crux, too. So somewhere between 1 big pad and 6 any size pads.
content.location: To the right of El Bano, Left of the Asphalt Wall

content.description: Right most line on the Brutality overhang. SDS just left of the arÃªte, climb through pockets to a rail just over the lip. Continue right thru big moves to the obvious chalky brownish jug. Drop off.
content.protection: Pads (2 min). Jagged rocks in the landing.
content.location: Right side of the Brutality Wall

content.description: Start in the obvious crack jug in the middle of Police Brutality, just right of a large tree.  Work up and right, pulling on sweet pockets, to a big move to the top of the arete.  Pull one more big easy move to the obvious jug and drop.
content.location: This is in the middle of the Police Brutality wall.  Starting crack/jug is very obvious.
